body:
My congratulations for responding so quickly, I am happy because I think your work is super cool :smile: :100: .

I already realized that it was okay to call an asynchronous function before, but I need this to work. Would you help me out of this? I need wait for call api and if have success, then remove from front.

> My congratulations for responding so quickly, I am happy because I think your work is super cool üòÑ üíØ .
> 
> I already realized that it was okay to call an asynchronous function before, but I need this to work. Would you help me out of this? I need wait for call api and if have success, then remove from front.

I will take a look at it, see if there is any work around.
hey @brunoJSX solution for now: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-forked-6fi7d?file=/src/index.js use Controller to wrap your inputs.

Hi @bluebill1049 

I'm very happy with this solution. The suport is very fast! Thanks :smile: .

Is it really a bug? If so, I‚Äôm even happier to help with this issue :laughing:
@bluebill1049 I just tested the v6.13.0 and solve my problem too.
@brunoJSX it's a strange one with `async` invoke method. I have made a patch anyhow.

issue.title: Bump react-hook-form from 6.12.2 to 6.15.4

repository.name: react-firebase-admin
repository.description: React ‚öõÔ∏è starter kit with Firebase üî• and Bulma for setting up an admin dashboard - Highly scalable, PWA, Serverless

issue.body:
Bumps [react-hook-form](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form) from 6.12.2 to 6.15.4.
Release notes

Sourced from react-hook-form's releases.

Version 6.15.4

üêû fix missing key for useFieldArray test üêû fix #4259 correct unset on field array values (#4262)
üêû fix #4260 watch missing type for undefined as the first argument (#4261)

v6.15.3

üêû fix #4251 issue with re-render during unmount field array (#4252) üôèüèª fix: the issue of unmounted component trying to set state after reset for field arrays (#4150)

Version 6.15.2

üêû fix #4219 Add default values when validating by using resolver (#4229) üêû fix #4170 by removing field array @‚ÄãuseEffect with shouldUnregister (#4172) üêû fix #4141 remove prod check at useEffect to fix dev/prod inconsistent behavior (#4149)

Version 6.15.1

üêû fix #4084 useWatch react with typed value (#4085)

Version 6.15.0

‚úåüèª close #2516 by look up fieldArray parent node (#4029) üêû fix #4019 validate function pass processed value (#4023) üêû fix #3985 radio input default state to null instead of empty string (#3988) üî¢ close #3963 valueAsNumber empty string return NaN instead of 0 (#3965)

Version 6.14.2

üéØ close #3908 with nested field value with deep equal (#3910) üêû fix #3875 with nested useFieldArray remount (#3900) ü•ã fix #3850 change method from pop to slice (#3866)

Version 6.14.1

üêû fix #3851 with invalid formState type (#3854) üêû fix #3834 dirty fields reset after input unmount with shouldUnregister: false üêû fix #3819 issue with dirty fields during swop action (#3824)

Version 6.14.0

üåü new formState: isValidating (#3672) üêû fix #3795 staled field array value (#3798) üêû fix #3785 perf issue with setValue deep clone (#3797) üåµ remove extra ref and update tests (#3734) üëç close #3712 stop watch trigger re-render with onBlur (#3716) üêû fix #3696 issue with get nested field array value (#3703)

Version 6.13.1

üêû fix #3689 missing id with nested child array (#3690) üêû fix #3684 issue validate pattern with value as null (#3685) üì¶ close #3677 improve setValue with field array (#3688) üôÑ close #3664 with async useFieldArray remove (#3665)

Version 6.13.0

üåü custom hook: useController (#3488)

... (truncated)

  • 4dcf12a üôèüèª fix: issue of unmounted component trying to set state after reset for fiel...
  • 6d5b0da 6.15.2

  • 45e8694 üêû fix #4170 by remove field array @‚ÄãuseEffect with shouldUnregister (#4172)

body:
Hey! I have a similar problem with current 7.18.1 version.
For me it seems that useForm getValues method is not aligned with useFieldArray fields values correctly.
When I append 2 objects example object1 and object2 ( { id: uuid(), name: "" }) to field array it is saved for me in the redux store using values from getValues().
Then I unmount the form from component lets say by unselecting my active item.
Then by selecting active item again to mount the form with default values from redux (all ids are unique still) I remove object1 from fieldArray and then add new object3.

Expected result: 
Object2 and object3 should have unique ids from getValues()

Actual result:
Last added object 3 has the same id that object 2 from getValues().
Although useFieldArray fields have unique ids for object2 and object3.
So getValues() and array fields are not in sync correctly.

This seems to be a bug with react-hook-form

issue.title: Removing element from field array data is not iterable

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: üìã React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.18.1

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/mystifying-poitras-zxvfv?file=/src/components/SimpleForm.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the form
2. Click on add on Question 2
3. Click on Remove
4. See error

### Expected behaviour

No error and for element to be removed from field array.

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Relevant log output

```shell
Uncaught TypeError: data is not iterable
    at removeAtIndexes (index.esm.js:373)
    at removeArrayAt (index.esm.js:380)
    at Object._updateFieldArray (index.esm.js:1046)
    at Object.remove (index.esm.js:431)
    at onRemoveFromList (SimpleForm.tsx? [sm]:90)
    at onClick (getQuestionField.tsx? [sm]:117)
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
